    The main Qorus Java job API class

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static void clearPersistentStateData()
      Clears the job's state data in "JOB_PERSISTENT_STATE_DATA"
      static void err​(java.lang.String err, java.lang.String desc_fmt, java.lang.Object... args)
      Raises an error in a running job; does not affect the flow of execution in the job code The error information is stored in the "job_errors" table with a severity of OMQ.ES_Major and the business flag set to true
      static void errWithInfo​(java.lang.String err, java.lang.Object info)
      Raises an error in a running job; does not affect the flow of execution in the job code The error information is stored to the "job_errors" table, errors errors with a severity less than or equal to OMQ.ES_Warning are treated as warnings
      static void errWithInfo​(java.lang.String err, java.lang.String desc, java.lang.Object info)
      Raises an error in a running job; does not affect the flow of execution in the job code The error information is stored to the "job_errors" table, errors errors with a severity less than or equal to OMQ.ES_Warning are treated as warnings
      static void errWithInfo​(java.lang.String err, java.lang.String desc, java.lang.Object info, java.lang.String severity)
      Raises an error in a running job; does not affect the flow of execution in the job code The error information is stored to the "job_errors" table, errors errors with a severity less than or equal to OMQ.ES_Warning are treated as warnings
      static void errWithInfo​(java.lang.String err, java.lang.String desc, java.lang.Object info, java.lang.String severity, boolean business)
      Raises an error in a running job; does not affect the flow of execution in the job code The error information is stored to the "job_errors" table, errors errors with a severity less than or equal to OMQ.ES_Warning are treated as warnings
      static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> getConfigItemHash()
      Returns a hash of all configuration items for the current job as a combination of local and global configuration items Example:
      static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> getConfigItemHash​(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> local_context)
      Returns a hash of all configuration items for the current job as a combination of local and global configuration items Example:
      static java.lang.Object getConfigItemValue​(java.lang.String item)
      Returns the value of the given configuration item for the current job Example:
      static java.lang.Object getConfigItemValue​(java.lang.String item, java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> local_context)
      Returns the value of the given configuration item for the current job Example:
      static java.lang.Object getConfigItemValue​(java.lang.String item, java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> local_context, boolean expand_complex_values)
      Returns the value of the given configuration item for the current job Example:
      static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> getInfo()
      Returns a hash of job information about the current job
      static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> getOption()
      Returns the value of all job options
      static java.lang.Object getOption​(java.lang.String key)
      Returns the value of the named job option If the option is not set on the job, and it is a valid system option, then the value of the system option will be returned.
      static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> getOption​(java.lang.String... args)
      Returns the value of the named job option or options If the option is not set on the job, and it is a valid system option, then the value of the system option will be returned.
      static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> getPersistentStateData()
      Returns any job state data stored with savePersistentStateData()
      static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> getStateData()
      Returns any job state data stored with saveStateData()
      static void saveInfo​(java.lang.Object info)
      Saves information against the job instance in the database The information is serialized in YAML format and saved in the database in the "JOB_INSTANCE" row as a part of the job results.
      static void savePersistentStateData​(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> data)
      Serializes the given hash and stores against the job's state data in "JOB_PERSISTENT_STATE_DATA"
      static void saveStateData​(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> data)
      Serializes the given hash and stores against the job's state data in "JOB_STATE_DATA"
      static void setOption​(java.lang.String option, java.lang.Object value)
      Changes a single option value on a job If the job has defined job options and an invalid option is passed to the method, an exception will be raised.
      static void setOption​(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> opts)
      Changes option values on a job If the job has defined job options, and at least one invalid option is passed to the method, an exception will be raised; however all other valid options in the hash will be set before the exception is raised
      static boolean setTrigger​(java.time.ZonedDateTime ts)
      Sets a one-time custom trigger time for the job; returns true if set, false if ignored
      static int sleep​(int arg)
      Puts the current thread to sleep for a certain number of seconds If the job is stopping, this method returns immediately with a return value of -1; otherwise the current thread is put to sleep for the full time period requested.
      static int usleep​(int arg)
      Puts the current thread to sleep for a certain number of microseconds If the job is stopping, this method returns immediately with a return value of -1; otherwise the current thread is put to sleep for the full time period requested.
      static int usleep​(org.qore.jni.QoreRelativeTime arg)
      Puts the current thread to sleep for a certain number of microseconds If the job is stopping, this method returns immediately with a return value of -1; otherwise the current thread is put to sleep for the full time period requested.
      static void warn​(java.lang.String err, java.lang.String desc_fmt, java.lang.Object... args)
      Raises a warning in a running job; does not affect the flow of execution in the job code The warning information is stored to the "job_errors" table with a severity of OMQ.ES_Warning and the business flag set to true
      static void warnWithInfo​(java.lang.String err, java.lang.Object info)
      Raises a warning in a running job; does not affect the flow of execution in the job code The warning information is stored to the "job_errors" table with a severity of OMQ.ES_Warning
      static void warnWithInfo​(java.lang.String err, java.lang.String desc, java.lang.Object info)
      Raises a warning in a running job; does not affect the flow of execution in the job code The warning information is stored to the "job_errors" table with a severity of OMQ.ES_Warning
      static void warnWithInfo​(java.lang.String err, java.lang.String desc, java.lang.Object info, boolean business)
      Raises a warning in a running job; does not affect the flow of execution in the job code The warning information is stored to the "job_errors" table with a severity of OMQ.ES_Warning

    • Method Detail

      • err

        public static void err​(java.lang.String err,
                       java.lang.String desc_fmt,
                       java.lang.Object... args)
                throws java.lang.Throwable
        Raises an error in a running job; does not affect the flow of execution in the job code The error information is stored in the "job_errors" table with a severity of OMQ.ES_Major and the business flag set to true
        Parameters:
        err - the error code
        desc_fmt - the string_formatting "format specifier" for the warning description string; following arguments will be included in the description string as combined with Qore::vsprintf() "vsprintf()"
        args - the args for desc_fmt
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
        Since:
        %Qorus 3.1.0
        See Also:
        errWithInfo(), warn(), warnWithInfo()

      • errWithInfo

        public static void errWithInfo​(java.lang.String err,
                               java.lang.String desc,
                               java.lang.Object info,
                               java.lang.String severity,
                               boolean business)
                        throws java.lang.Throwable
        Raises an error in a running job; does not affect the flow of execution in the job code The error information is stored to the "job_errors" table, errors errors with a severity less than or equal to OMQ.ES_Warning are treated as warnings
        Parameters:
        err - the error code
        desc - a description for the error
        info - additional information to be saved with the error (data structures are serialized in YAML format and saved in the database)
        severity - the severity of the error, errors with a severity less than or equal to OMQ.ES_Warning are treated as warnings; see JavaErrorSeverityCodes for valid values (default = OMQ.ES_Major)
        business - set to true if the error represents a business error
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
        See Also:
        err(), warn(), warnWithInfo()
        Note:
        If the severity is less than or equal to OMQ.ES_Warning, the job instance does not get an OMQ.JS_Error status

      • errWithInfo

        public static void errWithInfo​(java.lang.String err,
                               java.lang.String desc,
                               java.lang.Object info,
                               java.lang.String severity)
                        throws java.lang.Throwable
        Raises an error in a running job; does not affect the flow of execution in the job code The error information is stored to the "job_errors" table, errors errors with a severity less than or equal to OMQ.ES_Warning are treated as warnings
        Parameters:
        err - the error code
        desc - a description for the error
        info - additional information to be saved with the error (data structures are serialized in YAML format and saved in the database)
        severity - the severity of the error, errors with a severity less than or equal to OMQ.ES_Warning are treated as warnings; see JavaErrorSeverityCodes for valid values (default = OMQ.ES_Major)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
        See Also:
        err(), warn(), warnWithInfo()
        Note:
        If the severity is less than or equal to OMQ.ES_Warning, the job instance does not get an OMQ.JS_Error status

      • warn

        public static void warn​(java.lang.String err,
                        java.lang.String desc_fmt,
                        java.lang.Object... args)
                 throws java.lang.Throwable
        Raises a warning in a running job; does not affect the flow of execution in the job code The warning information is stored to the "job_errors" table with a severity of OMQ.ES_Warning and the business flag set to true
        Parameters:
        err - the warning or error code
        desc_fmt - the string_formatting "format specifier" for the warning description string; following arguments will be included in the description string as combined with Qore::vsprintf() "vsprintf()"
        args - the args for desc_fmt
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
        See Also:
        job_warn(), warnWithInfo(), err(), errWithInfo()

      • saveInfo

        public static void saveInfo​(java.lang.Object info)
                     throws java.lang.Throwable
        Saves information against the job instance in the database The information is serialized in YAML format and saved in the database in the "JOB_INSTANCE" row as a part of the job results. This information is returned in the API as the "info" key in rest_job_result_hash data, for example in the return value to the REST rest_api_GET_latest_jobresults__id_ call.
        Parameters:
        info - the information to save
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
        See Also:
        getInfo()
        Note:
        the data stored here is different from the data returned by job_info()

      • getInfo

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> getInfo()
                                                                          throws java.lang.Throwable
        Returns a hash of job information about the current job
        Returns:
        a hash with the following keys:
        • jobid: the metadata jobid of the job type
        • job_instanceid: the id of the job instance
        • name: the job name
        • version: the job version
        • description: the job description
        • trigger: a String describing the timer/trigger for the job
        • last_executed: the last executed date/time of the job (NOTHING if never executed before the current iteration)
        • last_executed_job_instanceid: the last executed instance id of the job
        • single_instance: true if the job can only be run in a single Qorus instance, false if no such restriction is enabled
        • next: the next trigger date/time
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
        See Also:
        saveInfo()
        Note:
        the data returned here is different from the data stored by job_save_info()

      • saveStateData

        public static void saveStateData​(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> data)
                          throws java.lang.Throwable
        Serializes the given hash and stores against the job's state data in "JOB_STATE_DATA"
        Parameters:
        data - the state data to serialize and store against the job's state data in "JOB_STATE_DATA"
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
        See Also:
        getStateData(), svc_get_state_data(), rest_api_GET_latest_jobs__id_or_name_, rest_api_PUT_latest_jobs__id_or_name__setStateData
        Note:
        job state data is automatically cleared when a job instance gets a OMQ::StatComplete status

      • savePersistentStateData

                                    throws java.lang.Throwable
        Serializes the given hash and stores against the job's state data in "JOB_PERSISTENT_STATE_DATA"

      • setTrigger

        public static boolean setTrigger​(java.time.ZonedDateTime ts)
                          throws java.lang.Throwable
        Sets a one-time custom trigger time for the job; returns true if set, false if ignored
        Parameters:
        ts - the timestamp to trigger the job; must be in the future and before the next trigger time
        Returns:
        true if set, false if ignored; the call will be ignored if the date/time value is in the past or after the next scheduled job trigger time
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
        Note:
        when this API returns with a true return value, the job's custom trigger time has already been committed to the database

      • setOption

        public static void setOption​(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> opts)
                      throws java.lang.Throwable
        Changes option values on a job If the job has defined job options, and at least one invalid option is passed to the method, an exception will be raised; however all other valid options in the hash will be set before the exception is raised
        Parameters:
        opts - a hash of option-value pairs
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - JOB-OPTION-ERROR invalid option name
        See Also:
        getOption(), getOptionArgs()

      • setOption

        public static void setOption​(java.lang.String option,
                             java.lang.Object value)
                      throws java.lang.Throwable
        Changes a single option value on a job If the job has defined job options and an invalid option is passed to the method, an exception will be raised.
        Parameters:
        option - the option to set
        value - the value to set for the option
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - JOB-OPTION-ERROR invalid option name
        See Also:
        getOption(), getOptionArgs()

      • getOption

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> getOption()
                                                                            throws java.lang.Throwable
        Returns the value of all job options
        Returns:
        all job-level options are returned as a hash
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
        See Also:
        getOptionArgs(), setOption()

      • getOption

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> getOption​(java.lang.String... args)
                                                                            throws java.lang.Throwable
        Returns the value of the named job option or options If the option is not set on the job, and it is a valid system option, then the value of the system option will be returned.
        Parameters:
        args - the list of options to return
        Returns:
        the value requested directly if only one argument is passed, otherwise a hash of option keys and values; note that if no arguments are passed to the method all job-level options are returned as a hash
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
        See Also:
        setOption()
        Note:
        Invalid options do not cause an errors to be raised; the associated key values in the hash returned will be NOTHING

      • getOption

        public static java.lang.Object getOption​(java.lang.String key)
                                  throws java.lang.Throwable
        Returns the value of the named job option If the option is not set on the job, and it is a valid system option, then the value of the system option will be returned.
        Returns:
        the value of the requested option
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
        Note:
        Invalid options do not cause an errors to be raised; the associated value returned will be null

      • sleep

        public static int sleep​(int arg)
                 throws java.lang.Throwable
        Puts the current thread to sleep for a certain number of seconds If the job is stopping, this method returns immediately with a return value of -1; otherwise the current thread is put to sleep for the full time period requested. If this method (or usleep()) is called again after -1 is returned, then a "STOP-ERROR" exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        arg - the number of seconds to sleep
        Returns:
        0 if current thread was put to sleep for the full time period; -1 if the sleep was interrupted because the current object is being stopped
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - STOP-ERROR the current object is stopping and this method already returned -1 as a warning
        See Also:
        usleep()

      • usleep

        public static int usleep​(int arg)
                  throws java.lang.Throwable
        Puts the current thread to sleep for a certain number of microseconds If the job is stopping, this method returns immediately with a return value of -1; otherwise the current thread is put to sleep for the full time period requested. If this method (or sleep()) is called again after -1 is returned, then a "STOP-ERROR" exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        arg - the number of microseconds to sleep (1 microsecond = 1/1000000 of a second)
        Returns:
        0 if current thread was put to sleep for the full time period; -1 if the sleep was interrupted because the current object is being stopped
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - STOP-ERROR the current object is stopping and this method already returned -1 as a warning
        See Also:
        sleep()

      • usleep

        public static int usleep​(org.qore.jni.QoreRelativeTime arg)
                  throws java.lang.Throwable
        Puts the current thread to sleep for a certain number of microseconds If the job is stopping, this method returns immediately with a return value of -1; otherwise the current thread is put to sleep for the full time period requested. If this method (or sleep()) is called again after -1 is returned, then a "STOP-ERROR" exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        arg - the amount of time in microseconds to sleep (1 microsecond = 1/1000000 of a second)
        Returns:
        0 if current thread was put to sleep for the full time period; -1 if the sleep was interrupted because the current object is being stopped
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - STOP-ERROR the current object is stopping and this method already returned -1 as a warning
        See Also:
        sleep()

      • getConfigItemValue

        public static java.lang.Object getConfigItemValue​(java.lang.String item,
                                                  java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> local_context,
                                                  boolean expand_complex_values)
                                           throws java.lang.Throwable
        Returns the value of the given configuration item for the current job Example: 
        
Object val = JobApi.getConfigItemValue(item, local_context);
        Parameters:
        item - the name of the job configuration item; job configuration item values take precedence over values on global level if both are set otherwise if both are not set the default value is returned
        local_context - the caller can supply its "local" context for template variables (plus user context info is added - see UserApi::getUserContextInfo() method)
        expand_complex_values - if true then lists and hashes will have their string values expanded recursively
        Returns:
        the value of the given configuration item
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - CONFIG-ITEM-ERROR thrown if the configuration item is not valid
        See Also:
        jobconfigitems
        Note:
        the value is always substituted with com.qoretechnologies.qorus.UserApi.expandTemplatedValue() "UserApi.expandTemplatedValue()"; make sure and escape any "$" characters with a backslash ("\") to avoid template substitution

      • getConfigItemValue

        public static java.lang.Object getConfigItemValue​(java.lang.String item,
                                                  java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> local_context)
                                           throws java.lang.Throwable
        Returns the value of the given configuration item for the current job Example: 
        
Object val = JobApi.getConfigItemValue(item, local_context);
        Parameters:
        item - the name of the job configuration item; job configuration item values take precedence over values on global level if both are set otherwise if both are not set the default value is returned
        local_context - the caller can supply its "local" context for template variables (plus user context info is added - see UserApi::getUserContextInfo() method)
        Returns:
        the value of the given configuration item
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - CONFIG-ITEM-ERROR thrown if the configuration item is not valid
        See Also:
        jobconfigitems
        Note:
        the value is always substituted with com.qoretechnologies.qorus.UserApi.expandTemplatedValue() "UserApi.expandTemplatedValue()"; make sure and escape any "$" characters with a backslash ("\") to avoid template substitution

                                           throws java.lang.Throwable

Object val = JobApi.getConfigItemValue(item);

      • getConfigItemHash

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> getConfigItemHash​(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> local_context)
                                                                                    throws java.lang.Throwable
        Returns a hash of all configuration items for the current job as a combination of local and global configuration items Example: 
        
HashMap<String, Object> config = JobApi.getConfigItemHash(local_context);
        Parameters:
        local_context - the caller can supply its "local" context for template variables (plus user context info is added - see UserApi::getUserContextInfo() method)
        Returns:
        a hash of all configuration items for the current job; keys are config item names; values are config item values. If there are no config items for the current job, then an empty hash is returned.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
        See Also:
        jobconfigitems
        Note:
        • if there are local configuration item values and values on global level, local values will take precedence over the global values
        • values are always substituted with com.qoretechnologies.qorus.UserApi.expandTemplatedValue() "UserApi.expandTemplatedValue()"; make sure and escape any "$" characters with a backslash ("\") to avoid template substitution

      • getConfigItemHash

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> getConfigItemHash()
                                                                                    throws java.lang.Throwable
        Returns a hash of all configuration items for the current job as a combination of local and global configuration items Example: 
        
HashMap<String, Object> config = JobApi.getConfigItemHash();
        Returns:
        a hash of all configuration items for the current job; keys are config item names; values are config item values. If there are no config items for the current job, then an empty hash is returned.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
        See Also:
        jobconfigitems
        Note:
        • if there are local configuration item values and values on global level, local values will take precedence over the global values
        • values are always substituted with com.qoretechnologies.qorus.UserApi.expandTemplatedValue() "UserApi.expandTemplatedValue()"; make sure and escape any "$" characters with a backslash ("\") to avoid template substitution
